ContentStructure.title: PART  2
Welcome to Part 2
Section 2.1: Strategize for Academic Success
Section 2.2: Know Your Resources
Section 2.3: Practice Making Good Choices
Section 2.1 This section will answer these questions:
What can I do to reduce college-related stress?
What are some strategies for effective studying?
How can I avoid procrastination?
How can I reduce college-related stress?
Write your ideas in this box:
Submit
Section 1.1
Lowering Stress: Plan Your Activities
Section 2.1

Stress can make it harder to finish your work, and make it more tempting to take a dishonest shortcut.  Avoid getting overwhelmed by assignments and extracurricular responsibilities. Plan your activities around your course assignments and try to finish work early as often as possible.
Lowering Stress: Self Care and Relaxation
Section 2.1

Allow yourself time to rest and recharge between activities and homework.  Plan leisure activities to break up your schedule, practice good sleep habits, and exercise routinely to reduce stress and improve mood.
Avoiding Procrastination
Section 2.1

Don’t wait until the last minute to do homework or study for an exam.  Procrastination causes stress and can lead to cheating, since you’re under pressure to finish quickly.  Also, completing assignments in a rush results in poor quality work, and you probably won’t learn what you need from the assignment.
Avoiding Procrastination: Due Dates
Section 2.1

Check your course syllabus to see when assignments are due, and use a calendar or make a list to keep track of the due dates.  Whenever possible, complete your work early. This reduces stress and gives you time to receive tutoring or feedback on the assignment.
Effective Studying
Section 2.1

Effective studying is key to academic success.    Studying helps you retain information and better understand in-class lectures and activities.  Studying regularly also helps you perform better on tests and quizzes, and you’re more likely to remember the information after finishing the class.
Effective Studying: Avoid Distractions
Section 2.1

Improve your study time by turning off electronic devices.  You might think you’re getting a lot of studying done while texting, browsing social media, or watching TV, but your attention is divided. This makes it difficult to retain the information.  Give studying your complete attention, and check your electronic devices on your breaks.
Effective Studying: Small Steps
Section 2.1
Don’t try to do everything at once.  If you have a big project, break it down into small parts. Work on these one at a time.
If you’re part of a group project, make sure everyone has a specific task to complete.
If you’re studying for a test, review the material one section or chapter at a time.
How to Stop Procrastinating Watch the video below for extra advice on avoiding procrastination.
Section 2.1

Section 2.1
Section 2.2 This section will answer these questions:
What are citations, and why do they matter?
What other resources does South offer to help me succeed in my classes?
Where can I get help with writing papers?
What are citations?
Section 2.2
Academic work requires you to read, discuss, analyze, and understand the ideas of scholars and writers.
When we use other people’s ideas in a paper or for a project, we use citations to give these people credit for their words and ideas.
Why are citations important?
Section 2.2
Citations tell your reader which words or ideas belong to someone else, and that you are making an honest effort to show that you got this information from another source.
In other words, you’re making sure that you don’t claim someone else’s hard work as your own.
Section 2.2
How do I add citations?
Citations usually go at the end of a sentence and match a Works Cited or References page at the end of the paper.
Different courses have different rules about citations. The most common styles are called MLA, APA, and Chicago.
Your professor will let you know what style you should be using.
Where can I get help with my papers?
Section 2.2
The USA Writing Center is free to USA students.
The Writing Center consultants can help students of all disciplines and class levels, including help with citations.
You can work one-on-one with a consultant, who will provide valuable feedback on your writing and help you develop writing skills needed to succeed in college.
Visit the USA Writing Center’s website at www.southalabama.edu/writing.
Where can I get help with other subjects?
Section 2.2
If you would like help in subjects other than writing, Jag Success is the place for you.
The tutors are called JagPALs (Peer Academic Leaders), who are academically successful students. They offer tutoring in many subjects, such as math, the sciences, and various humanities courses.
For more information about Jag Success, visit: https://www.southalabama.edu/departments/academicsuccess/jagsuccess.
Other Resources: JagSuccess The video below explains more about JagSuccess.
Section 2.2
Other Resources: The Marx Library
Section 2.2
USA’s main library is the Marx Library. Here, the librarians can provide expert help finding sources and using them appropriately.
The library also has a computer lab, group study rooms, and private study carrels, so it’s the perfect place to work on a project or prepare for an exam.
Other Resources: Your Professor
Section 2.2
Remember that your professor wants you to succeed.
If you’re overwhelmed or confused by an assignment, or you just want to make sure you’re maintaining your academic integrity, speak to your professor during his or her office hours.

Section 2.3: Practice!
You will be presented with ten scenarios.  Determine if each student’s action is a good strategy for academic success.  Click YES or NO to see if your answer is correct.
Section 2.3
I finished the rough draft of my English paper early, so I can get some feedback from the Writing Center.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Wrong answer.  This IS a good strategy for academic success!  By finishing his paper early, this student has plenty of time to receive feedback and make revisions. The Writing Center consultants can also help him make sure all of his citations are correct.  He won’t be stressed when the paper is due, and he can be proud of his hard work.
Hint: Remember, the Writing Center can help students cite sources correctly.

Correct answer!  This IS a good strategy for academic success!  By finishing his paper early, this student has plenty of time to receive feedback and make revisions. The Writing Center consultants can also help him make sure all of his citations are correct.  He won’t be stressed when the paper is due, and he can be proud of his hard work.
Hint: Remember, the Writing Center can help students cite sources correctly.
I’m going to skip class today. My professor doesn’t even take attendance.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Correct answer!  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Most professors do take attendance. Even if they don’t, the student should try to attend every class.  In-class assignments, lecture notes, and class discussions are very important to understanding the material and doing well on exams.   Students who miss class feel greater stress, and they’re more likely to cheat.
Hint: Even if the professor doesn’t take attendance, are there other important reasons to attend class?

Wrong answer.  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Most professors do take attendance. Even if they don’t, the student should try to attend every class.  In-class assignments, lecture notes, and class discussions are very important to understanding the material and doing well on exams.   Students who miss class feel greater stress, and they’re more likely to cheat.
Hint: Even if the professor doesn’t take attendance, are there other important reasons to attend class?
Hey, do you want to work on our group project this weekend?  It’s due on Tuesday.
But what about the football game? And the party?  Let’s just finish it Monday night.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Correct answer!  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Waiting until the last minute to finish a project leads to stress, and students are more likely to use dishonest methods of completing the assignment.  When assigned a big project, students should plan ahead so that they time to develop their own ideas and do good work.
Hint: Planning ahead can help students finish their work and still have time for fun.

Wrong answer.  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Waiting until the last minute to finish a project leads to stress, and students are more likely to use dishonest methods to complete the assignment.  When assigned a big project, students should plan ahead so that they time to develop their own ideas and do good work.
Hint: Planning ahead can help students finish their work and still have time for fun.
My professor assigned us a big research paper.  I better get some help at the library.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Wrong answer.   This IS a good strategy for academic success.  Finding good research can be difficult. If this student waits until the last minute, he’s more likely to copy and paste something off the internet--and that’s cheating.  By going to the library, he can get help from research experts who can show him the correct way to use outside sources in his paper.
Hint: Knowing your resources can help you maintain your academic integrity!

Correct answer!  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  Finding good research can be difficult. If this student waits until the last minute, he’s more likely to copy and paste something off the internet--and that’s cheating.  By going to the library, he can get help from research experts who can show him the correct way to use outside sources in his paper.
Hint: Knowing your resources can help you maintain your academic integrity!
Let’s study Chapters 1 and 2 tonight, and then we can do Chapters 3 and 4 next week.  That way, we’ll cover everything before the midterm exam.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Wrong answer.  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  As long as your professor approves, studying in a group can help you understand the material. If you study regularly, you’re more likely to remember what you learn.
Hint: Is it acceptable to study in a group before an exam?

Correct answer!  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  As long as your professor approves, studying in a group can help you understand the material. If you study regularly, you’re more likely to remember what you learn.
Hint: Is it acceptable to study in a group before an exam?
I stayed up until 3 AM studying for that history exam.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Correct answer!  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Studying is not just about passing an exam. In order to succeed in his career, this student needs to have a good understanding of the material covered in his classes.  Cramming at the last minute means he’s less likely to remember what he’s learned. Instead, he should study the material throughout the semester.
Hint: Does studying at 3 AM help the student truly understand the material?

Wrong answer.  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  Studying is not just about passing an exam. In order to succeed in his career, this student needs to have a good understanding of the material covered in his classes.  Cramming at the last minute means he’s less likely to remember what he’s learned. Instead, he should study the material throughout the semester.
Hint: Does studying at 3 AM help the student truly understand the material?
I thought I’d get some fresh air before meeting my biology tutor.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Wrong answer.  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  Balancing work and play is important to reducing stress. This student has found time to relax, but he isn’t letting it get in the way of studying.
Hint: Is relaxation important to academic success?

Correct answer!  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  Balancing work and play is important to reducing stress. This student has found time to relax, but he isn’t letting it get in the way of studying.
Hint: Is relaxation important to academic success?
I’ve got an algebra quiz next week, so I’m going to start reviewing our homework assignments.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Wrong answer.  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  By reviewing the homework ahead of time, the student reinforces the knowledge she learned in class. She will feel confident when she takes the quiz, and she won’t be tempted to cheat.
Hint: Can the student consider her homework assignments to be her own effort?

Correct answer!  This IS a good strategy for academic success.  By reviewing the homework ahead of time, the student reinforces the knowledge she learned in class. She will feel confident when she takes the quiz, and she won’t be tempted to cheat.
Hint: Can the student consider her homework assignments to be her own effort?
This paper is so easy. I’m going to write it really quick before class tonight.
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Correct answer!  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  It takes time to develop your own ideas.  By waiting until the last minute, this student will probably write a bad paper. He’s more like to make mistakes or forget his citations. He might even feel so stressed that he chooses to cheat.
Hint: Will this student have time to create work that makes him proud?

Wrong answer.  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  It takes time to develop your own ideas.  By waiting until right before class, this student will probably write a bad paper. He’s more likely to make mistakes or forget his citations. He might even feel so stressed that he chooses to cheat.
Hint: Will this student have time to create work that makes him proud?
The exam’s tomorrow. I’ve got to catch up on so much reading!
Is this a good strategy for academic success?
Section 2.3

Correct answer!  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  The student should keep up with the readings all semester. This will help her learn and understand the material, and she won’t be tempted to cheat on the final exam.
Hint: Taking your time means you’re more likely to remember what you’ve read.

Wrong answer.  This IS NOT a good strategy for academic success.  The student should keep up with the readings all semester. This will help her learn and understand the material, and she won’t be tempted to cheat on the final exam.
Hint: Taking your time means you’re more likely to remember what you’ve read.
Congratulations! You have completed Part 2 of the Academic Integrity Workshop.
